H5034.def: = process by which plants and their products become devoid of moisture, and therefore lose color and bend over ► which may ultimately result in death if circumstances do not change; ≈ associated with drought and destruction, often as punishment from God

H3515.def: = state in which an object has relatively much weight, ≈ which is often associated with slowness, functioning with difficulty, but also with importance, riches, status, etc.

H3201.def: mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H905.def: = woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of clothes; worn by priests and supernatural beings; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H3289.def: = action by which humans or deities exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H4136.def: = relational linking an event to a location right in front of another location

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H2094.def: = process by which an object emits or reflects intense light; ≈ regarded as awesome

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H2706.def: = specific actions required by somebody in authority

H8451.def: = causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H2372.def: = process by which someone perceives an important object with the eyes, or witnesses an event of some significance

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H3373.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H571.def: = state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

H1215.def: = possessions accumulated through advantageous transactions, in which part of the income can be kept for oneself, mostly achieved in an unjust way

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H8269.def: = someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

H505.def: = generic term for domesticated oxen, both male and female; ► kept for milk and used for plowing

H3967.def: = state in which a countable entity is one hundred in number

H2572.def: = state in which a countable entity is five in number

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H7043.def: = state in which animals and objects have the ability to move or act with speed ◄ due to lack of weight, agility, strength, training, or energy

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation
